result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon M Bohm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon M Bohm in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Defendant Brandon M Bohm in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:31 PM. Court took a few minutes prior to calling the case to review the victim impact statements and the PSI. State has complied with victim notification requirements and have filed both a restitution reporter and order and the VIS. Rielly has received the PSI and has gone over it with the defendant, no accuracies or errors. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends on counts #1 and #3 - 10 years in WI State Prison System on each count consisting of 5 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES - consecutive to each other; count #2 - 6 years in WI State Prison System consisting 2 years of initial confinement followed by 4 years of ES - concurrent to counts #1 and #3 and counts #1 and #3 to be consecutive to Marinette County Case #15CF60 - restitution to be joint and several with co-defendant Michael Junion (names and amounts on restitution report submitted) $1186.60 total including victim witness churcharge - ask for any prison wages/accounts be garnished to pay towards restitution. Rielly makes final recommendation prior to sentencing - recommends 3-4 years of initial confinement - concurrent to Marinette County case - 239 days credit. Discussion on credit. Bohm makes statement, would like Court to allow him to write an apology letter to the victims. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - 10 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 5 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years ES, #2 - 6 years in WI State Prison System consisting of consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 4 years ES, count #3 - 10 years in WI State Prison System, consisting of consisting of 5 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years ES; counts #1, #2 and #3 will be concurrent to each other but consecutive to time he is currently serving in Marinette County Case #15CF60, costs on each count - paid with 25% of any wages/income the defendant is entitled to, restitution as indicated in restitution report - paid with 25% of any wages/income that the defendant is entitled to - joint and several with co-defendant Michael Junion, submit DNA sample, not eligible for any programs, no additional credit due, no possession firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon M Bohm
Current: P.O. Box 3530, c/o Oshkosh Correctional Institute, Oshkosh, WI 54903-3530 United States  (Effective: 08-27-2015)
Prior: P.O. Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institute 530346, Waupun, WI 53963 United States

Defendant Brandon M Bohm in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Defendant Brandon M Bohm in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:50 PM. State - believes the defendant is on loan from Oshkosh Correctional Institute. Recess to allow Rielly time to go thru element sheet with the defendant (2:52 PM). Recalled at 3:14 PM with same appearances. State - plead to count #1 as alleged, plead to counts #2 and #3 as alleged, remaining counts DRI, both parties requesting PSI with both parties being free to argue. Rielly - had a recent PSI done in another county. State could possibly get a copy of that PSI. Discussion on need for a new PSI. State does not need PSI for sentencing argument. State wants Court to have PSI for stated reasons. Rielly responds. Bohm and Rielly agree. Bohm pleads G to counts #1, #2 and #3 as alleged. Court dismisses and reads in counts #4, #5, #6 and #7. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, requests PSI, amend bond to $3000.00 signature bond with same conditions, set for sentencing hearing 8 weeks out.

Attorney Michael John Rielly in court.  No appearance by defendant. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:04 pm. State - a writ was not done. Defendant is incarcerated at Dodge Correctional. State to prepare writ. Counsel has not talked to defendant. State - suggests talking to other attorneys on co-defendants cases. Court concerned that there is no agreement. Plea offer has been made by state. Counsel has not sent the offer to defendant. State will writ for the JT date and if counsel wants to plead, he could possibly get a date before then.  Jury trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon M Bohm in court/custody with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:21 pm. Rielly moves to sequestor. Court so orders. State calls Deputy Mullis sworn and direct 3:24 pm. Witness identifies defendant, 3:38 pm. Rielly cross 3:43 pm. State recross 3:46 pm. Witness excused 3:47 pm. Lieutenant Karcz sworn/direct by state 3:48 pm. Rielly cross 3:57 pm. State follow up 4:01 pm. Rielly follow up 4:01 pm. Witness excused 4:02 pm. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State files information (mirrors) proceed to ARGN. Rielly has info waives further reading and pleads NG to the 7 counts in information. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon M Bohm
Current: P.O. Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institute 530346, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 05-06-2015)
Prior: 205 Pleasant View, Apt 24, Pulaski, WI 54162

Attorney Michael John Rielly in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:49 AM. Brandon Bohm is not here - incarcerated in Dodge Correctional Institute. Court continues bond, sets for another PH and State to prepare writ.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon M Bohm appears via video from FOSO with attorney Michael John Rielly appearing in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:06 a.m. Rielly has gone over complaint with defendant and waives further reading, waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Brandon M Bohm in court, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:34 PM. Burns states they are having an issue getting someone appointed to this case for stated reasons. Bohm is being revoked. Court continues bond, set for AIA. Court will review its authority to appoint counsel and charge it back to SPD.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 09:45 am.
No contact or enter onto any premises owned/occupied by the families listed on the complaint, no consumption of alcohol.

Defendant Brandon M Bohm in court, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:17 PM. Bohm does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Bohm understands charges and penalties, wants attorney, called SPD and does qualify for SPD - Clerk will sent notice to SPD so they are aware of the date and time. Court sets for AIA. State - bond - $2500 cash bond with no contact with victims or enter on the premises of the homes listed in the criminal complaint. Court - bond - $2500.00 cash with conditions that the defendant not have any contact or enter onto any premises owned/occupied by the families listed on the complaint, no consumption of alcohol.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.
